reserved article viii  moving buildings permitrequired no building or part of any building shall be moved across any sidewalk street alley or highway within the city limits without first obtaining a permit from the building inspection officer    sameapplication  contents any person desiring to move a building shall first file with the building inspection officer and the chief of police a written application setting forth the following information 1 type and kind of building to be moved  2 the original cost of such building  3 the extreme dimensions of the length height and width of the building  4 its present location and proposed new location by lot block subdivision and street numbers  and 5 the approximate time such building will be upon the streets and the contemplated route that will be taken from present to new location    samerestricted if in the opinion of the building inspection officer and chief of police the moving of any building will cause serious injury to persons or property or serious injury to the streets or other public improvements or the building to be moved has deteriorated more than 50 percent of its original value by fire or other element or the moving of the building will violate any of the requirements of this of the zoning regulations the permit shall not be issued and the building shall not be moved over the streets of the city    bond required  amount  conditions a the building inspection officer and chief of police as a condition precedent to the issuance of a permit under the provisions of this article shall require a bond to be executed by the person desiring such removal permit with corporate surety to the satisfaction of building inspection officer b the bond shall be made payable to the city and for such amount as the city shall prescribe it shall indemnify the city against any damage caused by the moving of such buildings to streets curbs sidewalks shade trees highways and other property which may be affected by the moving of a building the surety bond shall also be conditioned upon and liable for strict compliance with the terms of the permit as to the route to be taken and the limit of time in which to effect such removal and to repair or compensate for the repair and to pay the city as liquidated damages an amount to be prescribed by the building inspection officer and chief of police for each and every days delay in completing such removal in repairing any damage to property or public improvement or in clearing all public streets alleys or highways of all debris occasioned thereby    notice required  contents upon the issuance of a moving permit under the provisions of this article the building inspection officer and the chief of police shall cause notice to be given to the superintendent of fire alarm chief of the fire department telephone or light companies or others whose property may be affected by such removal the building inspection officer and the chief of police shall set forth in all notices the route that will be taken time started and approximate time of completion    building remaining on streets any building being moved for which a permit was granted under the provisions of this article shall not be allowed to remain in or on the streets of the city for more than 48 hours    public safety requirements a every building which occupies any portion of public property after sundown shall have sufficient lights continuously burning between sunset and sunrise for the protection of the public b there shall be a minimum of five red lights placed on each street side of the building such red lights shall be attached to the building in such a fashion as to indicate extreme width height and size c there shall be placed in addition to the red lights on the building flares at regular intervals for a distance of 200 feet up the street on each side of the building d when more than 50 percent of the street measured between curbs is occupied at night by the building or when in the opinion of the building inspection officer and chief of police flagmen are necessary to divert or caution traffic the owner or person moving such building shall employ at their expense two flagmen one at each street intersection beyond the building such flagmen shall remain at these intersections diverting or cautioning traffic from sunset to sunrise red lights shall be employed in flagging traffic at night such flagmen so employed shall be furnished by the city at the expense of the applicant the minimum fee charged for each flagman shall be $500 per hour    secs 1821518236  reserved article ix  dangerous buildings footnotes  2  state law reference authority of municipality to commence an action in the name of the city to abate or enjoin any public nuisance injurious to the health morals comfort or welfare of the community of nuisances generally ala 197  65122 1147117 1147118  minimum housing standards and regulation of unsafe buildings ala 197  11531 et seq  municipal authority to repair or demolish unsafe structures ala 197  1153b1 et seq definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning dangerous building means any building or structure which has any or all of the following defects 1 interior walls or other vertical structural members which list lean or buckle to such an extent that a plumbline passing center of gravity falls outside the middle third of its base 2 one which exclusive of the foundation shows 33 percent or more of damage or deterioration of the supporting members or 50 percent of damage or deterioration of the nonsupporting enclosing or outside walls or covering 3 one which has improperly distributed leads upon the floors or roofs or in which the same are overloaded or which have insufficient strength to be reasonably safe for the purpose used 4 one which has been damaged by fire wind or other causes so as to have become dangerous to life safety morals or the general welfare and health of the occupants or the people 5 one which has become or is so dilapidated decayed unsafe unsanitary or which so utterly fails to provide the amenities essential to decent living that it is unfit for human habitation or is likely to cause sickness or disease so as to work injury to the health morals safety or general welfare of those living therein 6 one having light air and sanitation facilities which are inadequate to protect the health morals safety or general welfare of human beings who live or may live therein 7 one having inadequate facilities for egress in case of fire or panic or one having insufficient stairways elevators fire escapes or other means of communication 8 one which has parts thereof which are so attached that they may fall and injure members of the public or property 9 one which because of its condition is unsafe unsanitary or dangerous to the health morals safety or general welfare of the people    declared nuisances all dangerous buildings are declared to be public nuisances and shall be repaired vacated or demolished as provided in this article    building repair  vacation or demolition  standards the following standards shall be followed in substance by the building inspection officer in ordering repairs vacation or demolition 1 if the dangerous building can reasonably be repaired so that it will no longer exist in violation of the terms of this article it shall be ordered repaired 2 if the dangerous building is in such condition as to make it dangerous to the health morals safety or general welfare of its occupants it shall be ordered to be vacated 3 in any case where a dangerous building is 50 percent damaged or decayed or deteriorated from its original value or structure it shall be demolished and in all cases where a building cannot be repaired so that it will no longer exist in violation of the terms of this article it shall be demolished in all cases where a dangerous building is a fire hazard existing or erected in violation of the terms of this article it shall be demolished    building inspection officer  duties the building inspection officer shall 1 inspect or cause to be inspected semiannually all public buildings schools halls churches theaters hotels tenements commercial manufacturing or left buildings for the purpose of determining whether any conditions exist which render such places a dangerous building within the terms of this article 2 inspect any building wall or structure about which complaints are filed by any person to the effect that a building wall or structure is or may be existing in violation of this article 3 inspect any building wall or structure reported by the fire or police department of this city as probably existing in violation of the terms of this article 4 notify in writing the owner occupant lessee mortgagee agent and all other persons having an interest in the building as shown in the office of the judge of probate of this county of any building found by him to be a dangerous building within the standards set forth in this article one of the following responses to the notice is required a the owner must vacate or repair or demolish the building in accordance with the notice and this article  b the occupant or lessee must vacate the building or may have it repaired in accordance with the notice and remain in possession  or c the mortgagee agent or other person having an interest in the building may at his own risk repair vacate or demolish the building or have such work or act done provided that any person notified under this subsection to repair vacate or demolish any building shall be given such reasonable time not exceeding 60 days as may be necessary to do or have done the work or act required by the notice 5 set forth in the notice provided for in subsection 4 of this section a description of the building or structure deemed unsafe a statement of the particulars which make the building or structure a dangerous building and an order requiring the building or structure to be put in such condition to comply with the terms of this article within such length of time not exceeding 60 days as is reasonable 6 report to the city council any noncompliance with the notice provided for in subsections 4 and 5 of this section 7 place a notice on all dangerous buildings reading as follows this building has been found to be a dangerous building by the building inspection officer this notice is to remain on this building until it is repaired vacated or demolished in accordance with the notice which has been given to owner occupant lessee mortgagee or agent of this building and all other persons having an interest in the building as shown in the office of the judge of probate of this county it is unlawful to remove this notice until such notice is complied with    procedure taken by city council the city council shall 1 upon receipt of a report of the building inspection officer as provided in section 18240 give written notice to the owner occupant mortgagee lessee agent and all other persons having an interest in the building as shown by the land records in the office of the judge of probate of the county to appear before it on the date specified in the notice to show cause why the building or structure reported to be a dangerous building should not be repaired vacated or demolished in accordance with the statement of particulars set forth in the building inspection officers notice as provided in section 182407 2 hold a hearing and hear such testimony as the building inspection officer or the owner occupant mortgagee lessee or any other person having an interest in the building shall offer relative to the dangerous building 3 determine from the testimony offered pursuant to subsection 2 of this section as to whether or not the building in question is a dangerous building within the terms of this article 4 issue an order based upon the determination made pursuant to subsection 3 of this section commanding the owner occupant mortgagee lessee agent and all other persons having an interest in the building to repair vacate or demolish any building found to be a dangerous building and provided that any person so notified except the owners shall have the privilege of either vacating or repairing the dangerous building  or any person not the owner of the dangerous building but having an interest in the building may demolish the dangerous building at his own risk to prevent the acquiring of a lien against the land upon which the dangerous building stands by the city as provided in subsection 5 of this section 5 if the owner occupant mortgagee or lessee fails to comply with the order provided for in subsection 4 of this section within 30 days the city council shall cause such building or structure to be repaired vacated or demolished as the facts may warrant under the standards provided for in section 18239 and with the assistance of the city attorney shall cause the costs of such repair vacation or demolition to be charged against the land on which the building existed as a city lien or cause such costs to be recovered in a suit at law against the owner provided that in cases where such procedure is desirable and any delay thereby caused will not be dangerous to the health morals safety or general welfare of the people of this city the city council shall notify the city attorney to take legal action to force the owner to make all necessary repairs or demolish the building 6 report to the city attorney the names of all persons not complying with the order provided for in subsection 5 of this section within the tenday period in person or by mail to the public officer such request for a hearing shall set forth briefly the grounds or reasons on which the request for a hearing is based and the the party aggrieved set the matter down for hearing b the hearing provided in this section shall be held by the housing board of adjustments and appeals which board and its procedures have been set up in section 111 of the 2003 international property maintenance previously adopted by the city the appointment terms of office quorum and procedure of the board shall be as set out in the 2003 international property maintenance board shall have the power to hear appeals and to determine whether or not the true intent and meaning of this article or any of the regulations thereunder have been misconstrued or wrongfully interpreted or whether or not such order does manifest injustice under the circumstances if the board does find that any of the conditions described in this subsection exist it shall have the right to alter or amend any of the findings or decisions of the public official making such order and to make such order as in its opinion will properly and justly serve the interest of this article c a decision of the housing board of adjustments and appeals to vary the application of any provision of this article or to modify an order of the building inspection officer or public official shall specify in what manner such variation or modification is made and the conditions upon which it is made and the reasons therefor    sameextensions of time the public officer may extend the time for correction or abatement of the violations for an additional period of time not to exceed 30 days except where major capital improvements or renovations are involved in which instance the time for completion may be extended for a period not to exceed 90 days beyond the expiration date of the original notice    samesummary abatement in emergency where the violation or condition existing on the premises are of such a nature as to constitute an immediate threat to life and limb unless abated without delay the public officer may either abate the violation or condition immediately or order the owner operator or occupant to correct the violation within a period of time not to exceed three days and upon failure to do so the public officer shall abate the condition immediately thereafter and the costs thereof charged to the owner or operator charged with the responsibility of abating such condition    secs 1830218320  reserved division 3  owners or operators responsibilities subdivision i  in general maintenance of premises all parts of the premises under the control of the operator shall be kept in a clean and sanitary condition and the occupant shall refrain from performing any acts which would render other parts of the premises unclean or unsanitary or which would obstruct the owner or operator from performing any duty required by this article or maintaining the premises in a clean and sanitary condition    secs 1832218345  reserved subdivision ii  hazards and unsanitary conditions exterior premises and structures the exterior of the premises and of all structures thereon shall be kept free of all nuisances and any hazards to the safety of occupants pedestrians and other persons utilizing the premises and free of insanitary conditions any of the conditions described in this section shall be promptly removed and abated by the owner or operator it shall be the duty of the owner or operator to keep the premises free of hazards which include but are not limited to the hazards described in this subdivision    refuse brush weeds broken glass stumps roots obnoxious growths and accumulations of filth garbage trash refuse and debris shall constitute hazards and are prohibited    natural growths dead and dying trees and limbs or other natural growth which by reason of rotting or deteriorating condition or storm damage shall constitute a hazard to persons in the vicinity thereof trees shall be kept pruned and trimmed to prevent such conditions    overhangings loose and overhanging objects which by reason of location above ground level shall constitute a danger of falling on persons in the vicinity thereof    ground surface holes excavations breaks projections obstructions icy conditions and excretions of pets and other animals on paths walks driveways parking lots and parking areas and other parts of the premises which are accessible to and used by persons on the premises shall constitute a danger to persons in the vicinity all such holes and excavations shall be filled and repaired walks and steps replaced and other conditions removed where necessary to eliminate hazards or unsanitary conditions with reasonable dispatch upon their discovery    recurring accumulations of stormwater adequate runoff drains shall be provided and maintained in accordance with this eliminate any such recurrent or excessive accumulation of stormwater    sources of infestation any source of infestation by insects pests or rodents shall constitute a danger to persons in the vicinity    foundation of walls foundation walls shall be kept structurally sound free from defects and damage and capable of bearing imposed loads safely    chimneys and flue and vent attachments chimneys and all flue and vent attachments thereto shall be maintained structurally sound free from defects and so maintained as to capably perform at all times the functions for which they were designed chimneys flues gas vents or other draftproducing equipment shall provide sufficient draft to develop the rated output of the connected equipment  and shall be structurally safe durable smoketight and capable of withstanding the action of the flue gasses    exterior porches landings balconies stairs and fire escapes exterior porches landings balconies stairs and fire escapes shall be provided with banisters or railings properly designed and maintained to minimize the hazard of fallings and the same shall be kept structurally sound in good repair and free from defects    secs 1835618383  reserved subdivision iii  exterior appearance of premises and structures exterior premises and structures the exterior of the premises and the condition of accessory structures shall be maintained so that the appearance of the premises and all buildings thereon shall reflect a level of maintenance in keeping with the standards of the neighborhood or such higher standards as may be adopted as part of a plan of urban renewal by the city and such that the appearance of the premises and structures shall not constitute a blighting factor for adjoining property owners nor an element leading to the progressive deterioration and downgrading of the neighborhood with the accompanying diminution of property values including the standards contained in this subdivision    landscaping premises shall be kept landscaped and lawns hedges and bushes shall be kept trimmed and from becoming overgrown and unsightly where exposed to public view and where the same constitute a blighting factor depreciating adjoining property    signs and billboards all permanent signs and billboards exposed to public view shall be maintained in good repair any signs which have excessively weathered or faded or those upon which the paint has excessively peeled or cracked shall with their supporting members be removed forthwith or put into a good state of repair all nonoperative or broken electrical signs shall be repaired or shall with their supporting members be removed forthwith    windows all windows exposed to public view shall be kept clean and free of marks or foreign substances except when necessary in the course of changing displays no storage of materials stock or inventory shall be permitted in window display areas or other areas ordinarily exposed to public view unless the areas are first screened from the public view by drapes venetian blinds or other permanent rendering of the windows opaque to the public view all screenings of interiors shall be maintained in a clean and attractive manner and in a good state of repair    storefronts all storefronts shall be kept in good repair and shall not constitute a safety hazard or nuisance if repairs to a storefront become necessary such repairs shall be made with the same or similar materials used in the construction of the storefront in such a manner as to permanently repair the damaged area any cornice visible above a storefront shall be kept in good repair    awnings and marquees any awning or marquee and its accompanying structural members which extend over any street sidewalk or any other portion of the premises shall be maintained in good repair and shall not constitute a nuisance or a safety hazard if such awnings or marquees are not properly maintained in accordance with the provisions of this section they shall together with their supporting members be removed immediately if the awnings or marquees are made of cloth plastic or of a similar material the cloth or plastic where exposed to public view shall be maintained in good condition and shall not show evidence of excessive weathering discoloration ripping tearing or other holes nothing in this section shall be construed to authorize any encroachment on streets sidewalks or other parts of the public domain    secs 1839018406  reserved subdivision iv  general maintenance exteriors the exterior of every structure or accessory structure including fences signs and storefronts shall be maintained in good repair all surfaces shall be maintained free of broken glass loose shingles crumbling stone or brick excessive peeling paint or other condition reflective of deterioration or inadequate maintenance to the end that the property itself may be preserved safety and fire hazards eliminated    floorsrequirements floors shall be considered to be structurally sound when capable of safely bearing imposed loads and shall be maintained at all times in a condition so as to be smooth clean free from cracks breaks and other hazards    samewashroom and water closet compartment washroom and water closet compartment floors shall be surfaced with water resistant material and shall be kept in a dry clean and sanitary condition at all times    supporting structural members supporting structural members are to be kept structurally sound free of deterioration and capable of bearing imposed loads safely    interior walls  ceilings a interior walls and ceilings of every structure shall be structurally sound and maintained in a clean and sanitary condition b walls and ceilings shall be considered to be in good repair when free from cracks breaks loose plaster and similar conditions walls shall be provided with paint paper sealing material or other protective covering so that the walls and ceilings shall be kept free of visible foreign matter and wellmaintained at all times  639   lighting of washrooms every washroom and water closet compartment shall be provided with permanently installed artificial lighting fixtures with a switch and wall plate so located and maintained that there is no danger of short circuiting from water from other bathroom facilities or from splashing of water    electrical servicerequirements all premises shall be properly connected to and be provided with electric power insulated conductors conforming to the electrical code    sameloose or exposed wiring except as otherwise provided in this article all wiring or cables shall be properly affixed or attached to the structure insulation shall be provided for all wiring and cables and kept in good repair    samefuses and protective devices maximum fuse sizes consistent violation in fuse installations without their knowledge where the correct maximum is stated and the fuse box is located within any part of the premises which is in the exclusive possession of occupants other than the owner    sameoverloading of circuits overloading of circuits is prohibited where the public officer finds after notice and hearing that by reason of the appliances and fixtures there is continuing overloading of an electrical line creating a hazard the owner shall be required to install a line of sufficient capacity to absorb the load to which the line is subjected or otherwise eliminate the conditions causing the overload for purposes of this section the public officer may consider the peak seasonal load to which the line is subjected in accordance with the electrical code    elimination of infestation every operator shall be responsible for the elimination of infestation in and on the premises subject to his control    maintenance of plumbing every shall not be deemed to authorize the delay of 30 days in the payment of the license due which may be enforced at once b in the case of persons who began business on or after the first day of the calendar year the license for such new business shall be increased by 15 percent for the first 15 days they shall be delinquent and shall be measured by an additional 15 percent for a delinquency of chapter or any person required to file a return under the provisions of this chapter or state law who shall fail neglect or refuse to file such return or any person or employer who shall refuse to applications and may refer any application to the city council for a determination of whether such license should or should not be issued b if the municipal governing body denies the issuance of any license referred to it the municipal clerk shall promptly notify the applicant of the city councils decision c if said applicant desires to appear before the municipal governing body to show cause why said license should be issued he shall file a written notice with the municipal clerk said notice to be filed within two weeks from the date of mailing by the city clerk of the notice of the denial of such license by the municipal governing body d upon receipt of said notice the municipal clerk shall promptly schedule a hearing to be held within 15 days from the date of receipt of such notice before the city council and shall give the notice of the date time and place of said hearing to the applicant e the applicant shall be given the opportunity to appear personally or counsel or both and the city council shall proceed to hear any evidence which may be presented both for and against the issuance of said license f if the city council determines from the evidence presented that in order to either provide for the safety preserve the health promote the prosperity or improve the morals order comfort and convenience of the inhabitants of the city said license should not be granted it shall enter an order to that effect  otherwise said license shall be ordered issued upon payment of any required license fees  12182007 procedure for revocation or suspension of license a any lawful license issued to any person to conduct any business shall be subject to revocation by the city council for the violation by the licensee his agent servant or employee of any provision of this chapter or of any ordinance of the city or any statute of the state relating to the business for which such license is issued  and shall also be subject to revocation by the city council if the licensee his agent servant or employee under color of such license violates or aids or abets in violating or knowingly permits or suffers to be violated any penal ordinance of the city or any criminal law of the state  and shall also be subject to revocation by the city council if in connection with the issuance or renewal of any license the licensee or his agent filed or caused to be filed any application affidavit statement certificate book or any other data containing any false deceptive or other misleading information or omission of material fact b the conditions hereinabove set forth as grounds for the revocation of a license shall also constitute grounds for refusing to renew a license c the city council shall set a time for hearing on the matter of revoking or refusing to renew a license  and a notice of such hearing shall be given to the licensee or the applicant for renewal as the case may be at least ten days before the day set for said hearing at the hearing the city council shall hear all evidence offered by any party and all evidence that may be presented bearing upon the question of revocation or the refusal of renewal as the case may be  12182007 refunds on overpayments a any shall be filed with the city within two years from the date of payment of the business license tax which is the subject of the petition c the city shall either grant or deny a petition for refund within six months from the date the petition is filed unless the period is extended by written agreement of the taxpayer and the city the taxpayer shall be notified of the citys decision concerning the petition for refund by first class us mail or by certified us mail return receipt requested sent to the taxpayers last known address if the city fails to grant a full refund within the time provided herein the refund petition shall be deemed to be denied d if the petition is granted or the city or a court otherwise determines that a refund is due the overpayment shall be promptly refunded to the taxpayer by the city together with interest to the extent provided for in ala 197  115192 if the city determines that a refund is due the amount of overpayment plus any interest due thereon may first be credited by the city against any outstanding tax liabilities due and owing by the taxpayer to the city and the balance of any overpayment shall be promptly refunded to the taxpayer if any refund or part thereof is credited to any other tax by the city the taxpayer shall be provided with a written detailed statement showing the amount of overpayment the amount credited for payment to other taxes and the resulting amount of the refund e a taxpayer may appeal from the denial in whole or in part of a petition for refund by filing a notice of appeal with the clerk of the circuit court of the county in which the city denying the petition for refund is located said notice of appeal must be filed within two years from the date the petition was denied the circuit court shall hear the appeal according to its own rules and procedures and shall determine the correct amount of refund due if any if an appeal is not filed with the appropriate circuit court within two years of the date the petition was denied then the appeal shall be dismissed for lack of jurisdiction  12182007 delivery license a in lieu of any other type of license a taxpayer may at its option purchase for $10000 plus the issuance fee a delivery license for the privilege of delivering its merchandise in the city if the taxpayer meets all of the following criteria 1 other than deliveries the taxpayer has no other physical presence within the city or its police jurisdiction  2 the taxpayer conducts no other business in the city other than delivering merchandise and performing the requisite setup and installation of said merchandise  3 such delivery and setup and installation is performed by the taxpayers employees or agents concerns the taxpayers own merchandise in that city and is done by means of delivery vehicles owned leased or contracted by the taxpayer  4 the gross receipts derived from the sale and any requisite setup or installation of all merchandise so delivered shall not exceed $7500000 during the license year  5 any setup or installation shall relate only to a that required by the contract between the taxpayer and the customer or as may be required by state or local law  and b the merchandise so delivered  6 if at any time during the current license year the taxpayer fails to meet any of the above stated criteria then within ten days after any of said criteria have been violated or exceeded the taxpayer shall purchase all appropriate business licenses from the city for the entire license year and without regard to this section b mere delivery of the taxpayers merchandise by common carrier shall not allow the city to assess a business license tax against the taxpayer but the gross receipts derived from any sale and delivery accomplished by means of a common carrier shall be counted against the $7500000 limitation described in the preceding section if the taxpayer also during the same license year sells and delivers into the taxing jurisdiction using a delivery vehicle other than a common carrier c a common carrier contract carrier or similar delivery service making deliveries on behalf of others shall not be entitled to purchase a delivery license d the delivery license shall be calculated in arrears based on the related gross receipts during the preceding license year e the purchase of a delivery license shall not in and of itself establish nexus between the taxpayer and the city for purposes of the taxes levied by or under the authority of ala 197 tit 40 or other provisions of law nor does the purchase of a unauthorized intrusion false alarm means an alarm signal transmitted or made by an alarm system or automatic detection device which indicated the existence of an emergency situation and such situation is transmitted to the police department of the city when in fact no such emergency situation exists signaling device means an electrically operated instrument other than an automatic protection device which transmits alarms upon receipt of a stimulus from a detection apparatus    5261992 service charge for false alarms in addition to other penalties for violations of this article there shall be city constitute a hazard to the safety of police officers and firefighters of the city and the public in general false alarms enhance the dangers of automobile collisions en route to burglary robbery or fire alarms substantially increase police officers and firefighters manhour costs and divert police and fire resources from regularly assigned duties b responsibility of operator each person upon whose premises or upon premises in his charge control or possession on which there is maintained or operated an alarm system shall be responsible for all false alarms transmitted by such alarm system it shall be unlawful for any person to operate or maintain an alarm system on any premises owned by him or in his charge control or possession which transmits or emits in excess of three false alarms within 90 days after such system has been installed for more than 60 days c report of corrective action by operator the chief of police or fire chief may require from the appropriate person using servicing possessing or maintaining a faulty alarm system proprietor alarm or audible alarm a report in writing within such reasonable period as is specified by the chief of police or fire chief describing the corrective action which has been and will be taken to ensure the violation of this section will not reoccur    5261992 restrictions on use of alarm systems it shall be unlawful for any person to make or cause or commit to be made or caused upon any premises occupied or controlled by him any loud and unnecessary noise or sound emitted from an audible alarm system which is physically annoying to persons or which is so harsh or so prolonged in its use time and place as to occasion physical discomfort or which is injurious to the health peace comfort privacy or tranquility of the reserved division 2  gasoline meters required  sellers every person selling gasoline at retail within the city limits shall have the gasoline measured every gasoline pump or other container by whatever name the gasoline is delivered shall be equipped with a meter    consumers pumps  meters required each pump tank or other container owned and used by any consumer of gasoline who is not a dealer shall be equipped with a meter to indicate the true measurement of gasoline discharged from such tank pump or container    specification of meters  inspection  attachment to pumps or containers a the meters specified in this article shall be of a standard type to meet the specifications of the inspector of weights and measures the meters shall be subject to inspection at all times by the inspector such meters shall be read at prescribed intervals by such inspector b the meters shall be properly attached to pumps or containers so as to show the true reading and measurement of the gasoline discharged by such vessel they shall be so attached as to be conveniently read    tampering with meters  record of readings a no person shall tamper with the meters attached to gasoline pumps or containers or turn back the reading on the meter except under orders of the inspector of weights and measures b a correct record shall be made and kept of the readings of the meters and of any turning back of the indicators on the meters    filling station license  meters required the city clerk and treasurer shall not issue a license for the operation of any gasoline filling station unless charitable person shall not be deemed a professional solicitor by reason of his participation in charitable solicitations made by or on behalf of his employer religious and religion or church mean any activity directly involving the promulgation or observance of any system of worship or to the building or maintenance of places of worship the terms religious and religion or church as used in this chapter do not include charitable activities even though carried on or sponsored by a religious organization solicit and solicitation mean the request directly or indirectly of money credit property financial assistance or other thing of value on the plea or representation that such money credit property financial assistance or other thing of value shall be used for a charitable purpose as those purposes are defined in this section these terms shall also mean and include but not be limited to the following methods of securing such money credit property financial assistance or other thing of value 1 any oral or written request 2 the making of any announcement to the local press or by telephone concerning a local appeal or campaign to which the public is requested to make a contribution for any charitable purpose connected therewith 3 the distribution circulation posting or publishing of any handbill written advertisement or other local publications 4 the sale of or the offer or attempt to sell any advertisement advertising space book card chance coupon device membership merchandise subscription ticket or other thing solicitation means and shall be deemed to have taken place when the request is made whether or not the person making the request receives any contribution referred to in this section    legislative findings of city council a the city council finds determines and declares that 1 numerous persons and organizations have been and are soliciting funds in the city on the representation that such funds are to be used for charitable purposes when in truth and in fact such funds are being used in large part for the private profit of unscrupulous individuals promoting such solicitation 2 a variety of frauds and misleading devices are employed in such solicitations 3 persons engaged in the business of promoting solicitations fail to properly account for funds solicited 4 telephone solicitations by professional solicitors and professional promoters are a cause of annoyance to the individuals solicited and in many cases tactics used by such solicitors are coercive abusive or misleading 5 as a result of such pernicious activities honest deserving and needed charities suffer 6 residents of the city have been and are in constant peril of being defrauded and imposed upon due to a lack of adequate regulation of charitable solicitations b the city council believes that if the public were given full information concerning the solicitations it could protect itself against victimization by disreputable fundraisers and therefore it is necessary in the interest of the public welfare of the city for the city council to regulate solicitations for charitable purposes    exceptions to chapter a the provisions of this chapter with the exception of the applicable requirements of sections 306 3037 3038 3042 3043 and 3044 shall not apply to any person soliciting charity for himself if such person is blind or incapacitated and unable to work b all solicitations by political parties and bona fide candidates for public office are specifically exempted from the provisions of this chapter    notice of intent a required to be filed  contents any person except churches and their directly connected agencies desiring to conduct a charitable solicitation or on whose behalf a charitable solicitation is to be conducted shall file at least 60 days prior to the commencement thereof with the city council and clerk and treasurer a notice of intent containing the following information 1 the proposed use of the net proceeds of the solicitation under the general headings required for reports under subsection a5 of this section 2 the manner in which the solicitation shall be conducted and an estimate of the cost of solicitation and the cost of promotion if any and of the net proceeds expected for the charitable purpose 3 if a professional promoter or any professional solicitor is to be employed a copy of the contract of each 4 a certified copy of the resolution or other action authorizing the solicitation 5 a report of all the receipts of the person conducting the solicitation during his preceding fiscal year or all of his receipts from solicitations during the most recent year in which a charitable solicitation was conducted by or on behalf of such charitable person such report shall show the gross amount raised by solicitation during the period covered what portion thereof if any is attributable to promotional activities the cost of promotion the cost of solicitation and the amounts if any paid to each professional promoter and professional solicitor the report shall also show what portion of the proceeds if any was allocated for local use and what portion if any was allocated to a national organization b report of fund allocation and use the proportions allocated respectively to local use or to a national organization shall each be broken down in the report under the following categories insofar as they are applicable or among such other categories as may be approved by the city council 1 agency administration 2 information and public education activities 3 social services 4 hospital care 5 educational institutions 6 research 7 other civic or philanthropic purposes 8 capital improvements c waiver of filing the city council may in its discretion waive the filing of such statements as are duplicated substantially by reports already on file pursuant to this section or to any other section of this chapter    written receipt required  exception a any person receiving money or anything having a value of $100 or more from any contributor under a solicitation made pursuant to a permit granted under this chapter shall give to the contributor upon request a written receipt signed by the solicitor showing plainly the name and permit number of the person under whose permit the solicitation is conducted the date and the amount received b this section shall not apply to any contributions collected by means of a closed box or receptacle used in solicitation with the written approval of the city council where it is impractical to determine the amount of such contributions    misrepresentation in solicitations a no person shall directly or indirectly solicit contributions for any purpose by misrepresentation of his name occupation financial condition social position residence or principal place of business no person shall make or cause to be made any misstatement deception or fraud in connection with any solicitation of any contribution for any purpose in the city or in any application or report filed under this chapter b no charitable organization or professional fundraiser soliciting contributions shall use a name symbol or statement so closely related or similar to that used by another charitable organization or governmental agency that the use would tend to confuse or mislead the public c no charitable organization or professional fundraiser shall solicit funds by the use of statements or material that would indicate that such funds were being raised for an organization or agency from which such organization or agency has not received explicit permission for the raising of such funds in accordance with other provisions of this chapter    books and records required no person shall solicit any contributions for any charitable purpose without maintaining a system of accounting whereby all donations to it and all disbursements by it are entered upon the official books or records of the persons treasurer or other financial officer    report to city council required all persons registered and issued permits under this chapter shall furnish to the city council and clerk and treasurer within 60 days after the solicitation has been completed a report and financial statement showing the amount raised by the solicitation  the amount expended in collecting such funds including a report of the wages fees commissions and expenses paid to any person in connection with much solicitation  and the disposition of the balance of the funds collected by the solicitation in the case of charitable organizations maintaining a permanent office in the city the wages of regular fulltime staff employees may be entered as a total figure the entire report filed by the person shall be available for public inspection the permit holder shall make available to the city council or to any person designated in writing by the city council as its representative for such purpose all books records and papers whereby the accuracy of such report may be verified    solicitation from occupants of motor vehicles solicitation of funds for charitable purposes from occupants of motor vehicles on the streets and at the intersections of streets in the city is prohibited    secs 30103036  reserved article ii  registration and permit required  exception a no person shall solicit contributions within the city for any person or charitable purpose unless the established and bona fide membership thereof or the normal constituency or supporters thereof  or 2 if the solicitation is in the form of collections or contributions of regular assembly or services council may for good cause shown allow the filing of an application less than 60 days prior to the effective date of the registration and permit applied for b the application shall contain the and method of the proposed solicitation and whether such solicitation is in the interest of and not inimical to the safety convenience or welfare of the residents of the city c if while any application is pending or during the term of any permit granted thereon there is any substantial change in fact policy or method that would materially alter the information given in the application the applicant shall notify the city council in writing thereof within 72 hours after such change should the applicant fail to so notify the city council any permit issued to the applicant prior thereto shall stand suspended until a hearing is had pursuant to section 3439    disclosure of cost of solicitation the cost of solicitation for a charitable solicitation shall be disclosed on the citys total expense of regulating charitable solicitations during the preceding calendar year b   investigation of application  access to records a the city council and clerk and treasurer shall examine all applications filed under section 3038 and make or cause to be made such further investigation of the application and the applicant as the city council and clerk and treasurer deems necessary in order for it to perform its duties under this article b upon request by the city council the applicant shall make available for inspection by the city council or any person designated in writing by the city council as its representative for such purpose all of the applicants books records and papers at any reasonable time a permit is in effect or after a permit has expired    standards for granting  notice of denial a the city council shall grant the registration and permit as provided in section 3038 whenever it finds or reasonably believes 1 all of the statements made in the application are true 2 the applicant or if the applicant is not an individual person that its managing officers and managing agents be of good character and reputation for honesty and integrity 3 the local control and supervision of the solicitation will be under local responsible and reliable persons 4 the applicant is not engaged in any fraudulent transaction or enterprise 5 the solicitation will not be a fraud on the public 6 the solicitation is prompted solely by a desire to finance the charitable cause described in the application and will not be conducted primarily for private profit 7 that the kind character and method of the proposed solicitation are such that the solicitation will be in the interests of and not inimical to the safety convenience or welfare of the residents of the city b the city council shall file with its secretary for public inspection a written statement of its findings of fact and its decision upon each application if the application is denied the city council shall notify the applicant by certified mail return receipt requested at the address given in the application stating the reasons therefor    content  identification card  transferability or assignability a registrations and permits issued under this article shall bear the name and address of the person to whom the permit is issued the serial number of the permit the date issued the dates within which the permit holder may solicit and a statement that the permit does not constitute an endorsement by the city or by any of its departments officers or employees of the purpose or of the persons conducting this solicitation all permits must be signed by the city clerk and treasurer b each solicitor of the charitable organization will be provided with an information card or similar identification signed by the person having control and supervision of the solicitation the card or identification shall carry on its face the name and address of the person to whom the permit was issued the number of the permit and the dates during which the permit holder may solicit any individual soliciting without the card or identification shall be deemed to be in violation of this article the card or identification shall be provided for the individual solicitor by and at the expense of the permit holder c any permit issued by the city council under this article shall not be transferable or assignable    denial of application  hearing  report a if the city council denies an application for registration and permit it shall notify the applicant of its decision and the grounds therefor by certified mail return receipt requested within five days after the receipt of such notification the applicant may file a written request for public hearing on the application together with exceptions to the grounds upon which the city council based its denial of the application b upon the filing of such request the city council shall fix a time and place for the hearing within 15 days after the request is filed and notify the applicant thereof at the hearing the applicant may present evidence in support of his application and exceptions any interested person may be allowed to participate in the hearing to present evidence in opposition to the application and exceptions within ten days after the conclusion of the hearing the city council shall render a written report either granting or denying the application and state the grounds upon which the decision is based c a copy of the report shall be served upon the applicant by certified mail return receipt requested the report shall constitute a public record    suspension or revocation a for cause  notice whenever it is shown or whenever the city council has reason to believe that any person registered under this article has violated any of the provisions thereof or that any promoter agent or solicitor of a permit holder has misrepresented the purpose of the solicitation the city council shall immediately give the permit holder written notice to show cause in person or by certified mail return receipt requested of the hearing to be held as soon as practicable to determine whether or not the permit should be revoked this notice must contain a statement of the facts upon which the city council acted in suspending the permit b hearing at the hearing the permit holder and any other interested persons shall have the right to present evidence as to the facts upon which the city council based the suspension of the permit and any other facts which may aid the city council in determining whether this article has been violated and whether the purpose of the solicitation has been misrepresented c written statement of revocation if after such hearing the city council finds that this article has been violated or the purpose of the solicitation has been misrepresented it shall within two days after the hearing file in its office for public inspection and send to the permit holder by registered mail or serve him in any manner provided by general law for the service of notices a written statement of the facts upon which it bases such a finding and immediately revoke the permit d cancellation of suspension if after the hearing the city council finds that this article has not been violated and the purpose of the solicitation has not been misrepresented it shall within two days after the hearing give to the permit holder a written statement canceling the suspension of the permit and stating that no violation or misrepresentation was found to have been committed e notice to police chief in all cases where a suspension of the permit occurs the chief of police shall be notified immediately by the city council of the suspension or revocation of any permit issued under this article in like manner the city council shall immediately notify the chief of police subsequent to any hearing on the decision of the city council    civil emergencies which are the ingress and egress of the project area and the 16 block core downtown area    151999 creation of a design review board a creation the city council will create a design review board hereafter drb to perform the duties and responsibilities of the city in accepting considering and approving or rejecting applications for certificates of appropriateness as set out in the bylaws of the drb b members number appointment terms compensation officers rules and regulations 1 this board shall be composed of not less than seven members who shall have demonstrated experience or training in the fields of architecture urban planning or law the drb will be composed of the following persons a three members will serve by virtue of position those shall be 1 the director of economic and community development  2 tthe director of building and inspection services  and 3 the chairman of the historic preservation commission these members will serve on the drb for the duration of their employment in these positions b one member shall be a member of the city council and shall be appointed by the city council c one member shall be an architectural design professional and shall be appointed by the mayor and confirmed by the city council for a threeyear term d two members shall be selected from the downtown business community and shall be appointed by the mayor and confirmed by the city council for threeyear terms 2 members of the drb may be removed for cause by the city council 3 members of the drb may select a chairman and vicechairman and such other officers as the members deem necessary the drb shall adopt rules of procedure and shall communicate those rules of procedure to the city council and mayor the rules of procedure shall specify what number of members of the drb shall constitute a quorum 4 members of the drb will serve without compensation but may be reimbursed for reasonable expenses incurred on behalf of the drb in accordance with the rules of regulations for the reimbursement of expenses adopted by the drb 5 the drb may employ such professional technical office and other personnel as may be necessary to carry out the purposes and responsibilities of the drb 6 meetings of the drb shall be public meetings and shall be held at designated times and places as are specified in the bylaws of the drb 7 members of the drb may be reappointed 8 the city reserves the right and may delegate the duty to the design review committee drb to review and approve the redevelopers plans and specifications for redevelopment or rehabilitation such plans shall conform with the provisions of the city urban renewal plan and the harmonious development of the project area all such review and approval shall be concerned with but not limited to urban design standards site planning architectural treatment materials and color lighting signs parking loading landscaping detailed building plans elevations and construction specifications such review and approval shall be given in accordance with procedures as specified in the bylaws of the design review committee    151999 development objectives plan a objectives the 151999 project implementation a authority and redevelopment in implementing the city urban renewal plan the city shall purchase or have the authority to acquire by the exercise of eminent domain a part of the project area that it deems necessary convenient or proper to proceed with the purposes of the project the city may also enter into an agreement with a redeveloper as it deems necessary convenient or proper to develop any part or whole of the project area in accordance with the requirements set out herein b public improvements in addition to the improvements of the properties identified in the blighting conditions map necessary minor repairs to storm drains streets street lighting etc will be undertaken c acquisition the city council has determined that it is necessary desirable and in the interest of the public to acquire any identified properties by purchase or by the exercise of eminent domain all such properties shall be acquired by fee simple or any interest therein and the existing structures thereon may be demolished or rehabilitated as appropriate for redevelopment likewise other properties may be acquired and demolished or rehabilitated if the city council deems it to be necessary desirable and in the public interest so that all such acquired properties shall constitute a part of the acquisition property the city council may also acquire alleys and require the vacation of all acquired alleys for redevelopment if it is deemed necessary desirable and in the public interest for such acquisition and vacation to take place such acquisition shall take place on a casebycase basis d disposition the proposed acquisition plan is that properties that are considered blightedblighting shall be considered on a casebycase method upon assessment of each piece of property the need to dispose of by means of sale lease conveyance or other to redevelopers shall be determined those parcels which are meant to be subdivided or combined may be done so by virtue of surveys that describe the precise details and shall be determined as necessary proper or convenient by the city e rehabilitation and new construction plan review the redeveloper shall submit detailed plans to the design review committee for new construction including parking lots or the rehabilitation of any property located in the project area not to be acquired under the provisions of the city urban renewal plan the design review committee will review all the submitted plans using any and all procedures defined in the bylaws of the drb for conformance with the provisions of the city urban renewal plan and the desired harmonious development of the project area and as such these shall concern but not be limited to urban design site planning architectural treatment materials and color lighting signs parking loading landscaping building plans building elevations and construction details upon the approval of the plans a certificate of appropriateness will be issued by the drb and the redeveloper may submit applications for building soil erosion andor sedimentation control permits for any property located in the project area when the design review committee approves the plans submitted by a redeveloper as being consistent with the objectives of the city urban renewal plan the city shall authorize the processing of the plans for the issuance of the necessary building permit f commercial revitalization commercial revitalization shall take place in conformance with the provisions of the design review process applicable city codes property maintenance standards incentive programs and the management and technical assistance to business people property owners and residents of the project area g demolition all applications requesting demolition permits shall be submitted to the design review committee for review and approval the written approval from the design review committee of such an application shall be regarded as authorization for the processing of a demolition permit if an application submitted to the design review committee has not been acted upon by the design review committee for a period of six months as per proof presented by the property owner then the building inspection services shall process the application for a demolition permit h relocation 1 all efforts of acquisition demolition and construction by a redeveloper shall be undertaken in stages as presented in the city urban renewal plan so as to minimize any disruption to the surrounding existing businesses and establishments 2 it is the explicit right of the city to provide or require a redeveloper to provide all assistance as the city deems necessary proper and convenient to effectuate the purposes of the city urban renewal plan 3 there shall be no permanent residents in the acquisition property i zoning existing zoning classifications for the project area as shown in the city zoning map shall comply with the adoption of the city urban renewal plan in the event that a zoning classification change is requested or applied for all the established procedures as described in the city zoning ordinance shall be considered including but not limited to ending notices to affected property owners and the right of such property owners to be heard in a public hearing j historic preservation the review and approval of plans submitted for rehabilitation or demolition may include consideration for the preservation of historic structures and districts in accordance with the city urban renewal plan which have been or may be designated by the city the state or the united states department of the interior    151999 enforcement and penalty provisions a enforcement compliance with the terms of this article shall be enforced by the citys department of buildings and inspection 1 failure to comply with a certificate of appropriateness shall be a violation of this article the discontinuance of work or the lack of progress towards achieving compliance with a certificate of appropriateness as laid out in the bylaws of the drb shall be considered a failure to comply with the terms of this article 2 nothing in this article shall prohibit impair or limit in any way the power of the citys department of buildings and inspection to prevent the alteration construction restoration reconstruction rehabilitation or removal of buildings structures appurtenant fixtures or outdoor signs in the project area in violation of the provisions of this article 3 the enforcement of any remedy provided in this article shall not prevent the use and enforcement of any other remedy provided for by this violations of validly enacted ordinances of the city or state statutes b violations whenever by the provisions of this article and after review by the design review committee the performance of any act is required or prohibited regarding the alteration construction demolition or outdoor signage of any property under the jurisdiction of this article a parties failure to comply with such provisions shall constitute a violation of this article and shall be deemed a class a misdemeanor c liability for violations the owner tenant or occupant of any land or structure or part thereof and any architect builder contractor agent or other person who participates in assists directs creates or maintains any situation that is contrary to the requirements of this article shall be held responsible for the violation and be subject to the penalties and remedies provided therein d procedure of notification upon discovery of violation 1 upon discovery of a violation of this section the design review committee shall notify in writing by first class mail the party responsible for said violation such notice shall indicate the provisions of this article violated the nature of the violation the action necessary to correct the violation the date by which this violation must be remedied and the penalties for noncompliance service of such notice shall be deemed completed at the time of deposit in the post office or any united states mailbox in a sealed envelope postage prepaid and addressed to the person to be notified at his last known business or residence address as the same appears in the public records proof of this notice may be made by a return receipt signed by the recipient notified by united states mail 2 after written notification of such violation from the design review committee to the party responsible and the latters subsequent failure to rectify the situation the committee will notify the citys department of buildings and inspection of the noncompliance with this article an authorized employee of that department or an employee of the city shall serve a notice of noncompliance to the party responsible for the violation indicating the provisions of this article violated the nature of the violation and ordering the action necessary to correct the violation this notice shall be in the form of a written citation signed by an authorized employee of the citys department of buildings and inspection and shall be delivered to the offender either at his residence or at his place of business or at the place where the violation occurred this notice shall specify a date and time when the party responsible andor their agents are commanded to appear before the municipal court of the city if said party do not appear on the date specified a warrant will be issued for this partys arrest e penalty violation of any provision of this article shall subject the responsible party to a criminal penalty not less than $10000 nor more than $50000 or imprisonment not to exceed six months or both and costs of court for each offense penalties imposed upon a corporation shall consist of the fine only plus costs of court each day that a violation is allowed to continue in violation of this article shall constitute a separate and distinct offense f remedies any use of land or a structure or construction or alteration of a structure in violation of this article is hereby declared to be a nuisance per se the imposition of any penalty under the provisions of this section does not prevent equitable relief in the form of an injunction mandamus or other appropriate action or proceeding to correct or abate such violation or to prevent occupancy of such building structure    151999 state law existing city building and zoning codes not to prevent any property owner from making any use of his property not prohibited by other statutes ordinances and regulations    151999 conflict in the authority a the project area as shown in figure 1 project area map encompasses the boundaries of the urban renewal plan for the western area of the city entitled urban redevelopment and urban renewal plan for the western area in the city of bessemer alabama adopted by the city council on  by resolution no 66602 b the western area redevelopment project is authorized under ala 197 tit 24 chs 2 and 3 as amended as a separate distinct and independent urban redevelopment and renewal project and is in accordance with the department of community development goals and objectives c the goals and objectives of the plan have identified a set of design review standards adopted by the city council i 12172002 urban redevelopment and renewal project description a project summary the project will establish a land use plan for the project area to define the development of urban neighborhoods commercial development and industrial development in the targeted project area the project includes public improvements such as landscaping lighting infrastructure water and sanitary sewer street improvements and acquisition demolition and resale of property to be developed for uses appropriate to the project area the project will improve conditions for the continued development of residential office commercial industrial and recreational land uses the project will make provisions for the revitalization of commercial industrial and residential property as shown in figure 10 existing land use map b boundary figure 1 project area map shows the boundary of the project area which lies predominantly northwest of interstate 2059 between the mcashan drive interchange i2059 exit #104 to the south and murphys lane county road 36 and valley creek to the north figure 1 is incorporated herein by reference c redevelopment plan intent 1 to prevent the spread or the development of blight and blighting factors and deteriorating conditions  2 to eliminate all blighted and deteriorated conditions and the effects of blighting and deteriorating influences of improved and unimproved property  3 to eliminate dilapidation  overcrowding  obsolescence  inappropriate design  faulty arrangements  poor site conditions  a lack of ventilation light and sanitary facilities  excessive land coverage  deleterious land use  obsolete site layout  diversity of ownership or unusual conditions of title and underutilization  4 to promote sound growth of the project area and the community  5 to promote a practical and efficient transportation and traffic pattern that utilizes proper traffic flow and access management emphasizing a balance between vehicular transit bicycle pedestrian and other modes of travel and to minimize any disruption to existing and new development  6 to promote the development of sound retail service and office businesses industrial and manufacturing facilities and residential neighborhoods  7 to provide and improve public services such as streets sidewalks lighting utilitiesinfrastructure parks and open spaces and landscaping to create an attractive and inviting environment for pedestrians and motorists  8 to preserve and rehabilitate historic structures in the project area which have been or may be designated as such by the city the state or the united states department of the interior  and 9 to promote viable welldesigned residential neighborhoods within the project area with appropriate public infrastructure and amenities ii 12172002 development goals and objectives a general intent and application the development goals and objectives of the urban redevelopment and urban renewal plan for the western area in the city incorporated herein by reference shall include goals and objectives for the project area to guide the city in its review of all proposed developments in the project area these objectives shall apply to all the properties within the project area b goals and objectives the goals and objectives are as follows 1 goal 1 to encourage wellplanned industrial development in and around the powder plant road corridor the objectives are as follows a establish appropriate zoning regulations to ensure industrial development is planned and designed to preserve the scenic nature of the area b establish appropriate design guidelines that facilitate wellplanned attractive industrial and heavy commercial developments c develop a transportation plan for the project area to determine potential need for new roads to serve industrial growth and the accommodation of the future northern beltway 2 goal 2 to develop the visionland parkway and the academy drive area as a regional recreational and commercial tourist center the objectives are as follows a promote the theme park and outlet center as regional attractions to tourists and area residents b improve traffic access and visibility of the theme park and outlet center from interstate 2059 c encourage supporting recreational development adjacent to the theme park and outlet center d take advantage of access to the theme park and outlet center from the future northern beltway and future cedar hillvisionland parkway interchange e refurbish the existing municipallyowned golf course frank house municipal golf course by installing new updated irrigation equipment to ensure adequate water supply and updating the clubhouse facility to provide handicap accessible restrooms and meeting facilities 3 goal 3 to encourage commercial development in support of the theme park and outlet center the objectives are as follows a establish commercial zoning at the future cedar hillvisionland parkway interchange for i2059 b establish commercial zoning at the intersection of powder plant road and visionland parkway c encourage the revitalization andor redevelopment of singlefamily residential areas adjacent to the theme park outlet center and future cedar hillvisionland parkway interstate interchange 4 goal 4 to enhance the visual quality and experience of the academy drive powder plant road and visionland parkway corridors the objectives are as follows a establish design guidelines for industrial and commercial development within the project area to ensure appropriate site development landscaping and building design b preserve and protect natural scenic areas easements buffers and other development regulations c develop appropriate signage standards to prevent visual clutter associated with industrial and commercial developments along the academy drive powder plant road and visionland parkway corridors d collaborate with the metropolitan planning organization on the design of the proposed northern beltway within the project area to integrate this roadway within the overall development plans for the project area 5 goal 5 to encourage wellplanned commercial and industrial development around the mcashan drive interchange #104 of interstate 2059 the objectives are as follows a establish design guidelines for commercial and industrial development around the interchange to ensure appropriate site development landscaping and building design b develop appropriate signage standards to prevent visual clutter associated with commercial developments along mcashan drive 6 goal 6 to expedite the commercial growth of the academy way business park the objectives are as follows a provide adequate road access to facilitate commercial development b provide adequate water and sewer infrastructure c establish design guidelines for commercial development to ensure appropriate site development landscaping and building design c revision and amendment of development objectives revision and amendment of development objectives 1 the city planning commission shall have the authority to review the urban paved with a hard dustfree and erosion resistant material such areas shall be appropriately screened from all adjacent streets and sidewalks with but not limited to masonry walls fences trees and shrubs planted at an appropriate regular interval or a combination of these parking lots shall be designed with landscaped islands to accommodate deciduous trees at a minimum rate of one per 2500 square feet of gross parking area f all offstreet loading spaces shall be provided as needed and shall conform with minimum design standards adequate maneuvering spaces shall be provided within the property lines g no refuse or garbage shall be permitted to remain outside any building except as permitted under city codes and regulations there shall be designated areas for the location of containers and receptacles to afford refuse and garbage  and all such containers and receptacles shall be properly screened areas designated for the location of such containers shall not be permitted within the required front setback of a property areas designated for such containers and receptacles shall be located in the rear of the building or in a similar location which obscures the view of such receptacle from a public rightofway h no signs shall be permitted except for those which identify the property or the use conducted thereon there shall be no animated or pulsating signs all signs
